item.title: What did Vance's speech at the RNC reveal about the future of the GOP?
item.description: With J.D. Vance's speech at the convention, a new, young voice in Republican national politics was given its loudest megaphone. NPR's Michel Martin talks to Sarah Isgur, an editor at The Dispatch.

item.title: Indicted election deniers from several states are Republican Convention delegates
item.description: More than a dozen fake electors, indicted for crimes related to attempting to overthrow the 2020 election, are delegates at the RNC to nominate Donald Trump as he tries, again, to win a second term.

item.title: Ukraine's bookstores are thriving, but a top printing plant took a deadly hit
item.description: Ukraine's bookstores have expanded despite the war, fueled by interest in works by Ukrainian writers, some who have been killed by Russian forces. But a Russian missile struck a top printing plant.

item.title: Tons of dead fish cover a river in Brazil after alleged dumping of industrial waste
item.description: An estimated 10 to 20 tons of fish died on the Piracicaba River, prosecutors said. An initial investigation points to an "irregular discharge of wastewater" from a sugar and ethanol plant.
